isis.stitle: TSI 96-01-01 - Hendrickson Suspension Bogie Crossmember Crack

geninfo.para: Under certain service conditions, the bogie crossmember on 5000 Models (Paystar) with Hendrickson suspension may crack above the upper mounting hole of the four bolt, fore and aft, torque rod mounting bracket.

This crack can be repaired as instructed in the Frame service manual section (CTS-5007R) in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual, or by replacing the crossmember. To prevent repeat failures, reassembly should be made using locally fabricated 3/8 inch thick, cold rolled steel reinforcements - one for each side of the crossmember as illustrated in Figure 1.
A drawing to aid in fabricating the reinforcements is furnished in Figure 3.

Installation will require 3/4 inch longer Grade 8 bracket mounting bolts than were originally used to mount the torque rod brackets. To maintain the pinion angle, both torque rods will have to be shimmed 3/8 inch between the torque rod mounting bar and the differential mounting bracket, on both differentials ( Figure 2), to compensate for the 3/8 inch thick reinforcement mounted under each torque rod mounting bracket.
